intro: Acer lorbergii, commonly known as the Lorberg maple, is a deciduous tree native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves that turn vibrant shades of red and yellow in the fall. The tree produces small, yellowish-green flowers in early spring, followed by winged seeds. It typically grows to a height of 15–25 feet and has a compact, rounded shape. The bark is smooth and grayish-brown, with shallow furrows that become more pronounced as the tree matures.
